content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-342-10-A |Item_parent=Discomfort, loss of consciousness, coma in adults (see item 105) |Item_parent_short=Discomfort, loss of consciousness, coma in adults (see item 105) |Rank=A |Heading=Know the severity of malaise according to its cause and the monitoring to be undertaken. |Description=None |Item=Identification of the emergency |Contributors= |Order=10}} Severity linked to the aetiology, particularly cardiac causes - hospitalisation with continuous monitoring of cardiac rhythm

question.question: What is the recommended course of action for a patient with a malaise linked to a cardiac cause?
question.option_a: Continuous monitoring of vital signs at home
question.option_b: Hospitalisation with continuous monitoring of cardiac rhythm
question.option_c: Monitoring of cardiac rhythm only during office hours
question.option_d: No monitoring required, patient can be discharged immediately
